scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
statement:
SMTP is included in 3 national catalogues of recommended specifications. They belong to the Netherlands, Spain and Sweden.
The National Interoperability Framework (NIF) of these Member States is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the European Interoperability Framework (EIF) according to the National Interoperability Framework Observatory (NIFO) factsheets. 

National catalogue the Netherlands: 
https://www.forumstandaardisatie.nl/open-standaarden

National catalogue Spain:
https://administracionelectronica.gob.es/pae_Home/pae_Estrategias/pae_Interoperabilidad_Inicio/pae_Normas_tecnicas_de_interoperabilidad.html#CATALOGOESTANDARES

National catalogue Sweden:
https://www.avropa.se/globalassets/dokument/open-it-standards.pdf?_t_id=1B2M2Y8AsgTpgAmY7PhCfg%3d%3d&_t_q=standards&_t_tags=language%3asv%2csiteid%3a95d515a5-23ca-47bf-87a9-07b10d8ac360&_t_ip=178.139.72.144&_t_hit.id=Avropa_Core_Models_Media_GenericMedia/_ff07d720-f793-44b0-994d-27e79b28f6bd&_t_hit.pos=7

NIFO factsheets:
https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/collection/national-interoperability-framework-observatory-nifo/nifo-factsheets

criterion_description: All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
statement:
IETF has a formal review and approval so that all the relevant stakeholders can formally appeal or raise objections to the development and approval of specifications.
Each distinct version of an Internet standards-related specification is published as part of the "Request for Comments" (RFC) document series. This archival series is the official publication channel for Internet standards documents and other publications.
During the development of a specification, draft versions of the document are made available for informal review and comment by placing them in the IETF's "Internet-Drafts" directory, which is replicated on a number of Internet hosts. This makes an evolving working document readily available to a wide audience, facilitating the process of review and revision.

Standard process IETF:
https://www.ietf.org/standards/process/ 

Internet Best Current Practices IETF:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2026

criterion_description: The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis
statement:
Like all the IETF standards, SMTP is a free and open technical specification, built on IETF standards and licenses from the Open Web Foundation. SMTP is therefore licensed on a royalty-free basis.
No IPR disclosures have been submitted directly on the SMTP specification (RFC 5321)

Intellectual Property Rights in IETF:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3668

criterion_description: The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) was defined in 1982 as a method for e-mail transmission. Nowadays, it is still widely used between mail servers for e-mail messages exchange. Therefore, it is demonstrated that SMTP has enough maturity for its use in the development of products and services.

SMTP IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321

criterion_description: The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
statement:
SMTP is widely used and implemented in the context of email services, therefore, this fact demonstrates the market acceptance of the specification. Moreover, there are several implementations of the specifications that support the market acceptance of SMTP.

SMTP Transactional Email Solutions 2020:
https://formedbythemosthigh.com/2020/01/27/email-verification-25/

criterion_description: The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
statement: Although SMTP is widely used in the context of e-mail services, having enough maturity and market acceptance for the development of products and services, no evidence has been found that SMTP contributes to the creation of innovative solutions. Despite the findings on many implementations using SMTP, it is not possible to determine the implication of the specification on the creation of innovative solutions.

criterion_description: The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
statement:
The implementation of SMTP does not hamper the scalability and interoperability of systems. For example, SMTP allows to synchronize a Smarthost server which helps to synchronize any number of machines so you don't have to configure SMTP on each machine. The Smarthost server will manage all email accounts.

Advantages and disadvantages of an SMTP:
https://blog.mailrelay.com/en/2017/04/25/what-is-smtp-advantages-and-disadvantages-of-an-smtp-server

criterion_description: The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public services when legally possible.
statement: The specification is a protocol focused on the transaction of data involved in the email exchange. Even though it is related to data exchange, and it is aimed to ensure the delivery within email services, it is not involved in data portability amongst systems fostering the European Public Services.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.
statement:
This specification fosters the data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations. Moreover, it is capable to transport mail across multiple networks. But the main problem of this protocol is his inherent insecurity. SMTP does not include any security feature, therefore, it could be feasible for even fairly casual users to negotiate directly with receiving and relaying SMTP servers and create messages that will trick a naive recipient into believing that they came from somewhere else.

However, there are secured solutions that use SMTP as his core to make an email protocol secure, for example, SMTPS (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol Secure) or STARTLS-SMTP. But they could be analysed as different specifications.

SMTP IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321

Secure SMTP over Transport Layer Security:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3207

Practical study SMTP:
https://www.researchgate.net/publication/227859099_A_Practical_Study_of_E-mail_Communication_through_SMTP

statement:

_x000D_

Online Domain Tool:
http://mail-server-test.online-domain-tools.com/

criterion_description: The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
statement:
After searching in the different official European websites, a cross-border project, called SML software, has been found that uses SMTP as his email server configuration. The specification is included as the implementation of the eDelivery BDXL, which as the CEF eDelivery, aims to help the European public administrations to exchange digital data across borders fostering a common digital environment. The reference to the usage of SMTP can be found in the Quick Start Guide v2.2.

Main page project:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/SML

CEF eDelivery BDXL:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/display/CEFDIGITAL/eDelivery+BDXL+1.6

Quick Start Guide v2.2:
https://ec.europa.eu/cefdigital/wiki/download/attachments/82773331/BDMSL%20Quick%20Start%20Guide%20v2.2.pdf?version=1&modificationDate=1582037177388&api=v2

criterion_description: The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
statement:
After checking the different standard catalogues at supra-national level, there is no evidence of the inclusion of SMTP within any European catalogue of standards. However, a variant of SMTP that is safer in terms of network security, DANE for SMTP, is included in the European list of ICT Standards for e-procurement.

ICT technical specifications:
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

criterion_description: The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
statement: No evidence has been found of the specification being included in a formal interoperability agreement between organisations involved in the European public services provision.

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
statement:
After checking the assessments performed by CAMSS and the list of specifications identified by the MSP Multi-stakeholder-platform, no assessment verifying the compliance of the specification with the European standardisation regulation has been found._x000D_
_x000D_
ICT technical specifications:_x000D_
https://ec.europa.eu/growth/industry/policy/ict-standardisation/ict-technical-specifications_en

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
statement:
The purpose of SMTP is not related to the modelling of business processes. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

SMTP IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
statement:
The purpose of SMTP is not related to organisational interoperability.  Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to the specification. 

SMTP IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. The objective of the obtained assessment is to determine the suitability of the assessed interoperability specification for the delivery of interoperable European public services.
criterion_description: The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
statement:
SMTP defines a standardised method and elements for the electronic mail exchange that can be reused broadly across sectors, but it is not defining a data model. 

SMTP IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321

scenario_purpose: The European Interoperability Framework(EIF) provides guidance to public administrations on how to improve governance of their interoperability activities, establish cross-organisational relationships, streamline processes supporting end-to-end digital services, and ensure that existing and new legislation do not compromise interoperability efforts.This CAMSS Scenario allows to assess the compliance of interoperability specifications with the EIF. criterion_description: The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
statement:
The purpose of SMTP is not related to the publication of public data as linked open data. Therefore, this criterion is not applicable to this specification.

SMTP IETF reference:
https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5321

Five star linked open data:
https://www.w3.org/DesignIssues/LinkedData.html
